section.name: Why a scraping engine?
section.p: I need a system that will allow me to quickly write http scrapers, without having to implement the same code again and again. This pays back in development speed, stability and maintenance.

section.name: What is a scraping engine?
section.p: The point of the scraping engine is to have most of the legwork of scraping taken care of and just let the programmer worry about the actual parsing. In reality it's not web-based or scraping-based but is just a framework which grabs content from somewhere, and runs some form of transformation on that content.

section.name: Why simple-jndi for configuration?
section.p: This is another project of mine. I've found it very nice for configuring systems as there is zero code to add a new configuration option.

section.name: Why 'Scabies'?
section.p: Scraping-engine is part of a larger project that will be called Scabies. Thus the JIRA project name. Scabies because that involves itching, I think. I felt there were not enough open source projects named after medical problems. Incidentally, Scabies comes from the latin 'scabere', which means 'scratch'. Also known as 'the itch', and for some reason aka 'the seven year itch'.
